quotes.message: A woman's rank lies in the fulness of her womanhood: Therein alone she is royal.
quotes.name: George Eliot

quotes.message: Do not live someone else's life and someone else's idea of what womanhood is. Womanhood is you. Womanhood is everything that's inside of you.
quotes.name: Viola Davis

quotes.message: My ideal of womanhood has always been the pioneer woman who fought and worked at her husband's side. She bore the children, kept the home fires burning; she was the hub of the family, the planner and the dreamer.
quotes.name: Lucille Ball

quotes.message: The idea of perfect womanhood is perfect independence.
quotes.name: Swami Vivekananda

quotes.message: Womanhood is something you don't consider until it hits you.
quotes.name: Laura Marling

quotes.message: Anything may happen when womanhood has ceased to be a protected occupation.
quotes.name: Virginia Woolf

quotes.message: The heart of true womanhood knows where its own sphere is, and never seeks to stray beyond it!
quotes.name: Nathaniel Hawthorne

quotes.message: The true worth of a race must be measured by the character of its womanhood.
quotes.name: Mary Mcleod Bethune

quotes.message: The true aim of female education should be, not a development of one or two, but all the faculties of the human soul, because no perfect womanhood is developed by imperfect culture.
quotes.name: Frances Watkins Harper

quotes.message: It is against womanhood to be forward in their own wishes.
quotes.name: Philip Sidney

quotes.message: Real Womanhood isn't a function of becoming a great mother, but of being loved by your Great Father.
quotes.name: Ann Voskamp

quotes.message: Womanhood is the great fact in her life; wifehood and motherhood are but incidental relations.
quotes.name: Elizabeth Cady Stanton

quotes.message: The sanctity of womanhood is incompatible with social liberty and social claims; and for a woman emancipation means corruption.
quotes.name: Honor√© de Balzac

quotes.message: Pure womanhood plus priesthood means exaltation. But womanhood without priesthood, or priesthood without pure womanhood doesn't spell exaltation.
quotes.name: Harold B. Lee

quotes.message: The best things about womanhood might possibly even be the conversations. The chatting. The gabbing. The whispering. The hands-on-hips eye-rolling. The yukking-it up.
quotes.name: Katherine Center

quotes.message: The ultimate meaning of true womanhood is this: It is a distinctive calling of God to display the glory of his Son in ways that would not be displayed if there were no womanhood.
quotes.name: John Piper
